lib/lcd-lib.c File Reference

Lib to control a 4x20 character display with 3 wires the current file works only with 8Bit mode with 3 wires and a bit shifter called 74HC164N. It is only included if -DDEBUG_LCD is set at compile time. More...

#include <avr/io.h>
#include "lcd-lib.h"
Include dependency graph for lcd-lib.c:

Defines

#define LCD_MODE_SERIAL_8BIT
 LCD is connected in 8-bit mode with a 74HC164N bit shifter.
#define lcd_e_delay()   __asm__ __volatile__( "rjmp 1f\n 1:")
 delay which must be used between enable e and disable e pin
#define lcd_e_high()   LCD_E_PORT |= (1<<LCD_PIN_E)
 enable the e pin to write values to LCD
#define lcd_e_low()   LCD_E_PORT &= ~(1<<LCD_PIN_E)
 disable the e pin, LCD is not reading from data pins
#define lcd_data_high()   LCD_DATA_PORT |= (1<<LCD_PIN_DATA)
 enable data pin
#define lcd_data_low()   LCD_DATA_PORT &= ~(1<<LCD_PIN_DATA)
 disable data pin
#define lcd_clock_high()   LCD_CLOCK_PORT |= (1<<LCD_PIN_CLOCK)
 enable clock pin
#define lcd_clock_low()   LCD_CLOCK_PORT &= ~(1<<LCD_PIN_CLOCK)
 disable clock pin
#define lcd_command(X)   lcd_write_global((X),0)
 map lcd_command function to a global write function
#define lcd_write(X)   lcd_write_global((X),1)
 map lcd_write function to a global write function

Functions

static void lcd_toggle_e (void)
 Toggle the E (enable) pin to read data which is on the IO pins on the LCD.
void lcd_init (unsigned char cmd)
 Init the LCD.
void lcd_controller_init (unsigned char cmd)
 Init the controller.
void lcd_write_global (unsigned char byte, unsigned int command)
 Function which is called for all write proceses.
void lcd_puts (const char *s)
 Write a string to the LCD.
void lcd_putc (char c)
 Display a single character on the LCD.
void lcd_newline ()
 Display a newline on the LCD display.

 Display a character as digit.
void lcd_hex (uint8_t d)
 Display a char as hex.

Detailed Description

Lib to control a 4x20 character display with 3 wires the current file works only with 8Bit mode with 3 wires and a bit shifter called 74HC164N. It is only included if -DDEBUG_LCD is set at compile time.

Author:
Matthias Fechner <idefix@fechner.net>
Date:
Mon Nov 26 22:31:50 2007
